utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Rachel's bedroom; Rachel is awoken by a man singing in the next apartment.]

utterances.transcript: Morning's here! Sunshine is here! The sky is clear, the morning's here! The morning's here!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (singing, duh) Morning's here! Sunshine is here! The sky is clear, the morning's here! The morning's here!

utterances.transcript: HEY!! Do you have to do that? It's Saturday!
Oh come on! Morning's here! Morning's here! The morning is here! Sunshine is here!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh come on! Morning's here! (Starts singing) Morning's here! The morning is here! Sunshine is here!
(Rachel slams shut her window and storms into the living room, where Joey and Monica are eating breakfast.)

utterances.transcript: I hate this apartment! I hate the color of these walls! I hate the fact that this place still smells like bird! I hate that singing guy!
Are you kidding? I love that guy! Morning's here! Morning is here-
utterances.transcript_with_note: Are you kidding? I love that guy! (Starts singing) Morning's here! Morning is here-

utterances.transcript: Stop it! I will kill you. I hate the fact that my room is so small.
Hey, I have all the space I need. Just do what I did.
Monica, you don't even have a bed, you sleep in a ball on the floor!
Y'know what? I am really tired of your bellyaching! Okay, I-I worked really hard at making this a nice place for us to live!
I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.
Okay.
See, this is a great apartment.
Shut up! This place is a hole!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Ross's bedroom; Ross and Emily are making out. Ross as a new feature.]

utterances.transcript: Oh, blimey, I still can't believe you've got an earring!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Yep, it's a little gold loop.)

utterances.transcript: Huh? I know, I know. Who am I? David Bowe?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Huh? I know, I know. Who am I? David Bowe? (Shakes his head around, pretending like he's jamming.)

utterances.transcript: He does that?!
Uh, I don't know, whatever.
I think it makes you look really dangerous.

Oh, I know. Y'know what, I never would've gotten this if it weren't for you. No really, when I'm with you I'm-I'm like this whole other guy, I love that guy! I mean, I love you too, a lot, but that guy! I-I love that guy!
I love both of you!
Yeah?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They kiss.)

utterances.transcript: I wish I didn't have to go.
Then don't. Stay here. Just don't go so soon to London, just one more day.
Ohh, Ross, please!
One more day, seriously/
Don't do this to me, again. You'd know I'd stay here in a minute, but I'd really miss so much work, they'll fire me.
So, then you can stay as long as you want.
I wish I could.
Oh no. Don't, don't, don't start packing. Come on!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh no. Don't, don't, don't start packing. Come on! (She puts some clothes into her bag, and Ross throws them out.)

utterances.transcript: I don't think you understand packing. Look, I just don't want to leave it to the last minute. Last time I left in such a rush, I left my knickers here.
Yeah, I know, I uh, I tried them on.
You didn't!
No. No, I didn't. I didn't want to be that guy.

Hey, guys!

Man, didn't she like just get here?
Yeah!! Yeah!
Easy tiger.

I just, I hate this so much! I mean, every time I go pick her up at the airport, it's-it's so great. But at the same time I'm thinking, "Well, I'm gonna be right back there in a couple of days, dropping her off."

utterances.transcript: Hey!

utterances.transcript: What?!

Ohh, no. Ugh. Oh, leaving London, my whole family lives there.

My job!
Well, so, you-you'll get a job here! I mean, I'm always hearing about uh, them foreigners coming in here and stealing American jobs; that could be you!

No, I can't. I would, I really would, but my son is here; I can't leave him. Isn't-you don't think there's any way?
Ohh, I don't think so. I mean it would be different if it was way into the future –and-and-and we were getting married or something.

Yes.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Joey's bedroom, he is awoken by the singing guy.]

utterances.transcript: Morning's here! The morning's here!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (singing) Morning's here! The morning's here!
(Joey joins him.)

utterances.transcript: Sunshine is here! The sky is clear, the morning's here!
Hey! You're back!
Hey! Get into gear!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey! (Singing) Get into gear!

utterances.transcript: Breakfast is near!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (singing) Breakfast is near!

utterances.transcript: The dark of night has disappeared!!
I'll see you tomorrow morning!
Okay!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (happily) Okay!

plots: During the closing credits , Joey is woken up by The Singing Man singing the " Morning 's Here " song .
Joey joins in , and The Singing Man says he will see Joey tomorrow morning .
Joey is awoken by The Singing Man , then begins to sing himself .

span_qa.question: What did The Singing Man say is near ?
Who joined The Singing Man ?
When did The Singing Man say he will see Joey ?
Where did The Singing Man wake up Joey ?
What time of day does the Singing Man say is here ?
Who joins the Singing Man 's song ?
When will the Singing Man see Joey ?
Where was Joey when the Singing Man woke him up ?
